info.description: API to view loan information like ownership, roles, balances, due amounts, payment history, collateral details, limit, etc,.
info.title: US Model Bank Loan details

get.description: API to view loan information like ownership, roles, balances, due amounts, payment history, collateral details, limit, etc,.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

alternateAccountType.description: Specifies the Account type of the alternate account given.

accountStatus.description: Specifies the current status of the account, which is either active, inactive or closed.

branchId.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a branch of a financial institution.

accountCompany.description: Company of the account to be created

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

productDescription.description: Indicates the description of the Product

categoryId.description: Unique identifier associated with the product name of the account or contract. For example: For customer/counterparty accounts, the identifier would be in the range 1000 to 9999. For ledger accounts, in the range 10000 to 19999.

openingDate.description: The date the account is opened.

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

daysToMaturity.description: Indicates number of days remaining for maturity

dormancyDate.description: Date since when the account became dormant

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

accountTitle1.description: Title line 1 that will appear in notice and statements

accountTitle2.description: Title line 2 that will appear in notice and statements

accountTitle3.description: Title line 3 that will appear in notice and statements

accountTitle4.description: Title line 4 that will appear in notice and statements

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

ownershipCode.description: Captures the ownership classification of the account as per FDIC rules

purposeCode.description: Specifies the purpose of account, deposit or loan

loanCurrency.description: Indicates the currency of the loan

currentBalance.description: An accounts availableBalance plus any authorized credit and debit movements for the day, plus forward movements, minus funds in hold.

balanceCurrency.description: Currency in which balance is displayed

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

nextPaymentDate.description: Indicates next payment date for the contract

nextPaymentAmount.description: Indicates the payment amount to be settled in the next schedule

collateralValue.description: Value of the collateral considered by internal evaluation by the Financial Institution

collateralTypeId.description: Collateral classification Id defined in the system.

collateralId.description: The identifier of the collateral item

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

id.description: The identifier of the override.

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

properties.description: Input is the valid field name for the metrics evaluation of alerts

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

masterArrangementId.description: The unique identifier to specify an arrangement reference which is act as a Master for the arrangement being created.

roleName.description: Name of the role or sub contract that is displayed, for eg: Payments Inputter, Administrator, Clerk and etc.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

restriction.description: The user can flag this field to indicate that the activity is to be restricted and can further specify whether the transaction is completely blocked or allowed with a warning. If yes then restriction type has to be specified as error or warning

postingRestrictId.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are imposed on a Customer

restrictionStartdate.description: Start date for applying the restriction on an account

restrictionReason.description: Sets restrictions on the actions that can be performed on an account. Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName BLOCK.REASON.CODES.

restrictionExpirydate.description: Specifies the expirydate of the posting restriction on the account

unrestrictionReason.description: Captures the code that removes the restriction set on an account.  Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName UNBLOCK.REASON.CODES.

restrictionText.description: Free text information to capture the reason for restriction applied on an account

unrestrictionText.description: Reason for unblocking the restriction set on an account

alternateIdType.description: Contains the alternate account system identifier used for defining the alternate account Id

alternateId.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

businessDayCentres.description: The country or region code to be considered for determining the holidays and used while calculating the schedule dates.

shortTitle.description: Short title given to the name of the arrangement

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

productCategoryId.description: The identifier of the product category

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

baseDateType.description: Defines if anniversaryDate or start date is based on account creation or once disbursement is done. Allowed values are ARRANGEMENT and DISBURSEMENT. ARRANGEMENT indicates that account start period is considered as arrangement creation time. If set as DISBURSEMENT the account start period is based on disbursement activity date

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

originationReference.description: Identifier of the account in source system, eg, a origination system.

dateConvention.description: Indicates how the schedule date has to be adjusted when the schedule falls on a holiday. Allowed values are BACKWARD, FORWARD, FORWARD SAME MONTH or CALENDAR.

dateAdjustment.description: Defines the behavior when recurring payment dates falls on a weekend or bank holiday. The payment is then executed either the 'preceding' or 'following' working day. ASPSP might reject the request due to the communicated value, if rules in Online-Banking are not supporting this execution rule.

ffiecCode.description: Call report code for the account, deposit or loans per FFIEC. The values can be from FFIEC (RAID, RCON) or the values defined by Financial institution

holdTypeId.description: Purpose or the type of hold placed on the account  The available list of hold types can be retrieved through getHoldTypes

repeatOd.description: It denotes if an account has been overdrawn repeatedly based on the repeated overdraft conditions set for the account.

fdicDepositClassCode.description: Classification codes define an account or deposits specific sub-classification within the fdic deposit classification type as to the nature of the account such as Payable on death, living trust, business escrow, business trust, city, state and federal.

fdicDepositClassType.description: Classification type categorizes the fdicclasscode based upton the general purpose of the deposit such as Retail, Commerical, state and federal government etc,.

fdicOwnershipCode.description: Ownership codes defines an account or deposits specific to type of ownership for an account such as single, joint, partnership, trust and government.

reserveSweepReference.description: Savings account participating in Retail sweep program, Financial institution monitors credit and debit movements and it can adjust the reserve requirements. Dependening on the agreement on the balance that will be maintained in the savings deposit, the Financial institution can link different sweep definitions to reduce account reserve. The type of reserve sweep definition linked to an account is indicated here.

purposeCode.description: Specifies the purpose of account, deposit or loan

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

activities.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

appplicationPeriod.description: Denotes the application period for the given rule break charges which will be applied at the end of the period.If the value defined is zero, then the charges are applied immediately

applicationMethod.description: Denotes the method that needs to be applied to the rule break charges. Allowed values are Due, Defer, Capitalise. If it is set to Due then the Rule break charges are made due. If it is set to Capitalise then the Rule break charges are capitalised. If it is set to Defer then the Rule break charges are calculated but not applied immediately, charge are deferred and are collected over a period of time

chargeAutoSettle.description: This field aids turning off the automatic settlement for the corresponding charge. If set to yes settlement processing for the associated chage will be done based on the settlement configuration for the charge

advices.description: Determines the output formart of delivery messages and deal slips. The user can also provide their own mapping records to include customized business requirements

advice.description: Determines the output formart of delivery messages and deal slips. The user can also provide their own mapping records to include customized business requirements

activityClassId.description: Id of an activity class, e.g. ACCOUNTS-ACCRUE-CHARGE or LENDING-CAPITALISE-INTEREST.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

messageContent.description: It indicates whether only the current information or previous and current information needs to be passed to form the message.

sendAdvice.description: This field allows the user to determine whether the given advice or message needs to be sent for the given activity.

rules.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

ruleName.description: Name of the validation rule to be checked against an online or periodic activity.

periodicAttribute.description: Contains the user defined rule definition which is evaluated during the transaction based on the defined period

balanceType.description: Type of balance (e.g. current balance, credit interest accrued, deferred commission, etc.) as defined in the institution's accounting schemas.

periodicValue.description: Contains the periodic value for a specific product condition

activityClassId.description: Id of an activity class, e.g. ACCOUNTS-ACCRUE-CHARGE or LENDING-CAPITALISE-INTEREST.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

adjustmentDisplayname.description: Denotes the description for the adjustment

netAdjustmentAmount.description: The net adjustment for non-contingent balance types would be calculated and stored in this field by the system during Balance Adjustment, Write off activities of Balance maintenance.

adjustmentDifferenceAccount.description: Represents the account number to be used while adjusting balance amounts

tiers.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts. Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

tierType.description: Type of the tier rate. Allowed values: - BAND: rates apply within each band - LEVEL: a common rate applies, determined by the highest level

calculationType.description: Indicates calculation type for the given source balance

chgAmount.description: Based on the calculation type (flat or unit) the charge amount specified here will be set

tier.description: If the charge calculated for this tier is less than the amount defined in this field then minimum amount will be the charge amount for this tier.

tierMaxCharge.description: Indicates the maximum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

upTo.description: The monetary amount for the tier

tierCount.description: When charges are to be calculated based on activity count, this attribute acts as threshold for the number of times an activity is performed

chargeId.description: This indicates the charge code which will be triggered for payment stop instruction. Applicable when financial institutions would like to charge for stop payment of cheque etc.

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

chargeRoutine.description: This field enables the user to define a routine to apply complex conditions to calculate the charge amount as required by the user

tierGroups.description: This field defines the method of calculation of charge amount for the currency.This field will accept two values BANDS or LEVELS. If BANDS then separate calculations are to be made for each band till the base amount is reached.If LEVELS then only one is calculated and this is dependent on the level of the base Amount

relationshipProduct.description: Indicates the relationship pricing plan(if any) that has influenced the rate on this arrangement.

relationshipPercentage.description: Rate of margin(discount or uplift) due to the relationship of the customer with the bank

relationshipAmount.description: Flat amount as evaluated by the relationship of the customer with the bank. Would be evaluated based on the RELATIONSHIP arrangements held by the customer and also the definitions in PREFERENTIAL.PRICING as well as the rules in PRICING.RULES of this arrangement product.

relationshipVariation.description: It denotes the special considerations for the arrangement based on the customer relationship with the bank

penaltyDays.description: Specifies the number of days penalty will be applied for early redemption or violating the initial agreement

rentReturn.description: Indicates if unamortised rent amount has to be returned if a safe deposit box is closed before the tenure

penaltyDays.description: Specifies the number of days penalty will be applied for early redemption or violating the initial agreement

rentReturn.description: Indicates if unamortised rent amount has to be returned if a safe deposit box is closed before the tenure

tiers.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts. Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

calculationType.description: Indicates calculation type for the given source balance

chgAmount.description: Based on the calculation type (flat or unit) the charge amount specified here will be set

tier.description: If the charge calculated for this tier is less than the amount defined in this field then minimum amount will be the charge amount for this tier.

tierMaxCharge.description: Indicates the maximum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

upTo.description: The monetary amount for the tier

tierCount.description: When charges are to be calculated based on activity count, this attribute acts as threshold for the number of times an activity is performed

chargeId.description: This indicates the charge code which will be triggered for payment stop instruction. Applicable when financial institutions would like to charge for stop payment of cheque etc.

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

chargeRoutine.description: This field enables the user to define a routine to apply complex conditions to calculate the charge amount as required by the user

tierGroups.description: This field defines the method of calculation of charge amount for the currency.This field will accept two values BANDS or LEVELS. customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

taxPercentage.description: Tax liability percentage for the associated Customer

limitAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates percentage of limit allocated to the customer out of overall limit

liabilityPercentage.description: Liability percentage allocated to the associated Customer

deliveryReqd.description: Determines whether delivery messages need to be processed for the customer

otherParties.description: It specifies the other parties who are not legal owners of the arrangement

otherParty.description: It specifies the other parties who are not legal owners of the arrangement

otherPartyRole.description: It specifies the description about the other parties mentioned

otherPartyNotes.description: It specifies the description about the other parties mentioned

jointLiability.description: Identifies if there is a joint liability on the limit record Allowed values: -YES -NO

inActiveMilitaryService.description: Indicates if customer or account holder is in active military service

accountTitlingOperand.description: Account Title operand to be used while building the Title information in notices. Can be AND or OR. When AND is specified, it indicates that all beneficiaries are jointly responsible. When OR is specified, it indicates that each beneficiary can be solely responsible for the account.

interest.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate Allowed values: null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

fixedRate.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually.

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

linkedRateIndicator.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

minimumTierRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier.

maximumTierRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier.

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierNegativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier, select Yes, No, Block margin

tierPercent.description: Applicable tier percentage (between 0 and 100) for interest calculations based on amount bands

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriodType.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriod.description: Define the period which has to be used to calculate the interest rate

periodicMethod.description: Indicates the method used to calculate the interest rate for period interest setup

initialResetDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset.  If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

periodicReset.description: Indicates the reset period of the periodic index defined

customRate.description: It denotes whether or not interest needs be calculated in a custom manner

marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginOperation.description: This is the operand which determines if a margin is added or subtracted from the interest rate. Options are ADD or SUB

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

onActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

customType.description: Defines the type of attribute used to calculate the custom rate. It is an identifier for the customized rate attributes. It may hold user defined values like currency

customName.description: Defines the name of the customized rate attribute to calculate the custom rate

customValue.description: Defines the value for the corresponding customized rate attribute to calculate custom rate

rateTierType.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts.  Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

dayBasis.description: Contains the day basis on which the interest is calculated. Eg: 366/366, 360/365 (Interest days/days in the year)

interestCalcThreshold.description: Allows users to set a balance threshold which will need to be met to calculate interest

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

referLimit.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

accountingMode.description: Identifies the modes used in accounting system i.e. 'EXTERNAL' indicates external accounting mode.

periodicResetDateConvention.description: Specifies the date convention to be followed for the reset frequency i.e. if the cycled periodic reset date falls on a non-working day, the reset date will be moved based on the option chosen.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.
Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

otherOfficer.description: Specifies the additional officers who can assist with a product/arrangement

otherOfficerRole.description: It specifies the role defined for each additional officer of the product or arrangement

otherOfficerNotes.description: It specifies the notes related to the other officer entered by a user.

primaryOfficer.description: Specify the primary officer responsible for the arrangement

overdue.description: Denotes the current ageing status of the arrangement

ageingType.description: It denotes whether the ageing of arrangements should be based on the no of days or the no of outstanding bills . Allowed values are Bills or Days

ageing.description: It denotes either the no of days or no of bills  after which the arrangement moves to the specified ageing status . The number is followed by a 'B' if it denotes the no of bills

notice.description: It represents the calendar days post to a aging status that a chaser advice to be sent

noticeFrequency.description: It denotes the frequency in which chasers need to be sent out, so long as the account remains in the corresponding status.

ageAll.description: Indicates whether all bills of the arrangement should age to the current status . Allowed values are yes or no

suspend.description: Indicates whether the arrangement needs to be suspended when the current aging status is reached.

balance.description: The monetary value of each balance type for an account is itemised.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

payTolerance.description: Represents the tolerance percentage that needs to be applied on the bill's original amount

tolCCY.description: If the currency mentioned here matches the bills currency then the tolerance amount is considered for comparison

actions.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

action.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

payment.description: Indicates the transfer of money between two or more parties or accounts

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

billLeadDays.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

dueFrequency.description: Defines the frequency date when a payment  has to be made due. When not mentioned, this will be same as the paymentFrequency

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberOfPayments.description: Indicates the total number of payments for the loan or deposit. Then based on the payment frequency, the payment end date will be calculated.

adhocPaymentAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments  it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount.

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

combineBills.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

applyPaymentActivity.description: Indicates the action that will be performed when there is unallocated amount or unidentified transaction type

includePrincipalPayment.description: Flag to indicate if the IRA account is an inherited account

allowedProducts.description: Product or products allowed to be used within the product bundle.

allowedProductId.description: The list of products belonging to the same product group that the arrangement can switch to

changeDateType.description: Determines whether the product change should happen within the given period or on reaching maturity of the arrangement

changePeriod.description: Denotes the period after which the user can change the arrangement from one product to another

changeDate.description: Denotes the date on which arrangement would change from an existing product to a new product

changeActivity.description: Denotes the activity which will be triggered at the time of loan renewal.

priorDays.description: Indicates the number of days prior to  which change product needs to be triggered from the actual change product date

changeToProductId.description: Specifies the product to which the arrangement must change to on the given period or date

initiationType.description: It indicates whether the renewal activity will be triggered automatically or manually by the user. Possible values are AUTO , MANUAL

defaultActivity.description: Determines the defalut Activity which will be triggered on the day of renewal when INITIATION.TYPE is equal to MANUAL

trancheStartDate.description: Start date after which the tracheAmount can be withdrawn from the loan as per the withdrawal agreement.

trancheEndDate.description: End date by when the tracheAmount can be withdrawn from the loan as per the withdrawal agreement made

trancheAmount.description: Amount agreed for withdrawal from the loan on within the trancheStateDates and trancheEndDates

commitmenttype.description: Defines the type of commitment schedule being made. Options available are COMMITMENT.SCHEDULE or UNAVAILABILITY.SCHEDULE

commitmentType.description: Defines the type of commitment schedule being made. Options available are COMMITMENT.SCHEDULE or UNAVAILABILITY.SCHEDULE

commitmentStartDate.description: Defines the start date for the commitmentAmount for the Commitment type

commitmentEndDate.description: Defines the end date for the commitmentAmount for the Commitment type

commitmentAmount.description: Indicates the total amount which will be lent or deposited for the term

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

matDateType.description: Maturity date can be set to a fixed date or can set to align with the last payment date. When it has to be alinged with last payment date, indicate the option as PAYMENT.END.DATE

maturityDateConvention.description: Specifies the date convention for the maturity date calculation. When DATE.CONVENTION is specified, holiday calendar will be checked against date convention specified for the account. Otherwise the business calendar will be used for checking holidays.

termToleranceDays.description: Specifies the tolerance days beyond which TERM will be recalculated on change of maturity date. Ex, if TERM was 360D and Maturity date was on 31-Mar-2020, and tolerance days is 3D, of maturity date is changed to 2-Apr-2020, the TERM will be still remain as 360D. if there was no tolerance the TERM will be changed to 362D

fullCommitmentActivity.description: When set to YES, full disbursement activity will be raised when a deposit or loan is fully funded or disbursed.

hasTranches.description: Indicates if the loan is disbursed through a withdrawal agreement where the agreed loan amount is available for withdrawal upon the agreed schedule or based on user request.

renewalCoolingPeriod.description: Number of days to be considered for closure after renewal or rollover start date

fixedamount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

expiryDays.description: Defines the expiry date for the payoff bill. The number of days defined would be taken as working days and expiry date for the payoff bill would be calculated as payoff date plus the number of working days defined in this field. When the expiry date is reached the payoff bill would be deleted

settleDues.description: Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not. By setting this field to YES, auto settlement of future dues would be enabled and setting it to null or NO will not settle the due amounts automatically

action.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

events.description: A rule is assigned to a product and the rule determines whether a customer can buy that product or hold it after changes in circumstance.

field.description: Input is the valid field name for the metrics evaluation of alerts

operand.description: This field along with fieldName and value, defines the conditions for the alert to be triggered.

data.description: Contains any input parameters/data required for the job

payin.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payinRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

payinPaymentType.description: It denotes the payment type based on which the repayment settlement instruction will be processed

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPOProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPOProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

payByCheck.description: Indicates if payment or settlement has to be done through check

type.description: The product condition has an activity type associated that drives an action.

periods.description: Indicates spread of time buckets.Ex: 3M,6M,9M,10Y etc.

period.description: Indicates spread of time buckets.Ex: 3M,6M,9M,10Y etc.

dates.description: Date in the format YYYYMMDD. E.g. 20191231

initialDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset. If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

result.description: Status to determine requirements of the agents for scaling of services

aaaId.description: The Identifier of the aa record created

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

properties.description: Input is the valid field name for the metrics evaluation of alerts

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

masterArrangementId.description: The unique identifier to specify an arrangement reference which is act as a Master for the arrangement being created.

roleName.description: Name of the role or sub contract that is displayed, for eg: Payments Inputter, Administrator, Clerk and etc.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

transactionAmount.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

restriction.description: The user can flag this field to indicate that the activity is to be restricted and can further specify whether the transaction is completely blocked or allowed with a warning. If yes then restriction type has to be specified as error or warning

postingRestrictId.description: Identifies any restrictions for posting entries that are imposed on a Customer

restrictionStartdate.description: Start date for applying the restriction on an account

restrictionReason.description: Sets restrictions on the actions that can be performed on an account. Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName BLOCK.REASON.CODES.

restrictionExpirydate.description: Specifies the expirydate of the posting restriction on the account

unrestrictionReason.description: Captures the code that removes the restriction set on an account.  Allowed values can be retrieved through method getEbLookup, virtualTableName UNBLOCK.REASON.CODES.

restrictionText.description: Free text information to capture the reason for restriction applied on an account

unrestrictionText.description: Reason for unblocking the restriction set on an account

alternateIdType.description: Contains the alternate account system identifier used for defining the alternate account Id

alternateId.description: An Alternate Identification for the Deal. This can be used to retrieve the Deal for amendment.

businessDayCentres.description: The country or region code to be considered for determining the holidays and used while calculating the schedule dates.

shortTitle.description: Short title given to the name of the arrangement

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

productCategoryId.description: The identifier of the product category

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

portfolioId.description: Id of the portfolio or security account

baseDateType.description: Defines if anniversaryDate or start date is based on account creation or once disbursement is done. Allowed values are ARRANGEMENT and DISBURSEMENT. ARRANGEMENT indicates that account start period is considered as arrangement creation time. If set as DISBURSEMENT the account start period is based on disbursement activity date

anniversary.description: The start or end period defined in MMDD format to indicate the period when charge rules has to be applied

originationReference.description: Identifier of the account in source system, eg, a origination system.

dateConvention.description: Indicates how the schedule date has to be adjusted when the schedule falls on a holiday. Allowed values are BACKWARD, FORWARD, FORWARD SAME MONTH or CALENDAR.

dateAdjustment.description: Defines the behavior when recurring payment dates falls on a weekend or bank holiday. The payment is then executed either the 'preceding' or 'following' working day. ASPSP might reject the request due to the communicated value, if rules in Online-Banking are not supporting this execution rule.

ffiecCode.description: Call report code for the account, deposit or loans per FFIEC. The values can be from FFIEC (RAID, RCON) or the values defined by Financial institution

holdTypeId.description: Purpose or the type of hold placed on the account  The available list of hold types can be retrieved through getHoldTypes

repeatOd.description: It denotes if an account has been overdrawn repeatedly based on the repeated overdraft conditions set for the account.

fdicDepositClassCode.description: Classification codes define an account or deposits specific sub-classification within the fdic deposit classification type as to the nature of the account such as Payable on death, living trust, business escrow, business trust, city, state and federal.

fdicDepositClassType.description: Classification type categorizes the fdicclasscode based upton the general purpose of the deposit such as Retail, Commerical, state and federal government etc,.

fdicOwnershipCode.description: Ownership codes defines an account or deposits specific to type of ownership for an account such as single, joint, partnership, trust and government.

reserveSweepReference.description: Savings account participating in Retail sweep program, Financial institution monitors credit and debit movements and it can adjust the reserve requirements. Dependening on the agreement on the balance that will be maintained in the savings deposit, the Financial institution can link different sweep definitions to reduce account reserve. The type of reserve sweep definition linked to an account is indicated here.

purposeCode.description: Specifies the purpose of account, deposit or loan

accountType.description: Groups the products based on their type, eg, Checking, Savings, CD etc,.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

activities.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

appplicationPeriod.description: Denotes the application period for the given rule break charges which will be applied at the end of the period.If the value defined is zero, then the charges are applied immediately

applicationMethod.description: Denotes the method that needs to be applied to the rule break charges. Allowed values are Due, Defer, Capitalise. If it is set to Due then the Rule break charges are made due. If it is set to Capitalise then the Rule break charges are capitalised. If it is set to Defer then the Rule break charges are calculated but not applied immediately, charge are deferred and are collected over a period of time

chargeAutoSettle.description: This field aids turning off the automatic settlement for the corresponding charge. If set to yes settlement processing for the associated chage will be done based on the settlement configuration for the charge

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

advices.description: Determines the output formart of delivery messages and deal slips. The user can also provide their own mapping records to include customized business requirements

advice.description: Determines the output formart of delivery messages and deal slips. The user can also provide their own mapping records to include customized business requirements

activityClassId.description: Id of an activity class, e.g. ACCOUNTS-ACCRUE-CHARGE or LENDING-CAPITALISE-INTEREST.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

messageContent.description: It indicates whether only the current information or previous and current information needs to be passed to form the message.

sendAdvice.description: This field allows the user to determine whether the given advice or message needs to be sent for the given activity.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

rules.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

ruleName.description: Name of the validation rule to be checked against an online or periodic activity.

periodicAttribute.description: Contains the user defined rule definition which is evaluated during the transaction based on the defined period

balanceType.description: Type of balance (e.g. current balance, credit interest accrued, deferred commission, etc.) as defined in the institution's accounting schemas.

periodicValue.description: Contains the periodic value for a specific product condition

activityClassId.description: Id of an activity class, e.g. ACCOUNTS-ACCRUE-CHARGE or LENDING-CAPITALISE-INTEREST.

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

adjustmentDisplayname.description: Denotes the description for the adjustment

netAdjustmentAmount.description: The net adjustment for non-contingent balance types would be calculated and stored in this field by the system during Balance Adjustment, Write off activities of Balance maintenance.

adjustmentDifferenceAccount.description: Represents the account number to be used while adjusting balance amounts

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

tiers.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts. Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

tierType.description: Type of the tier rate. Allowed values: - BAND: rates apply within each band - LEVEL: a common rate applies, determined by the highest level

calculationType.description: Indicates calculation type for the given source balance

chgAmount.description: Based on the calculation type (flat or unit) the charge amount specified here will be set

tier.description: If the charge calculated for this tier is less than the amount defined in this field then minimum amount will be the charge amount for this tier.

tierMaxCharge.description: Indicates the maximum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

upTo.description: The monetary amount for the tier

tierCount.description: When charges are to be calculated based on activity count, this attribute acts as threshold for the number of times an activity is performed

chargeId.description: This indicates the charge code which will be triggered for payment stop instruction. Applicable when financial institutions would like to charge for stop payment of cheque etc.

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

chargeRoutine.description: This field enables the user to define a routine to apply complex conditions to calculate the charge amount as required by the user

tierGroups.description: This field defines the method of calculation of charge amount for the currency.This field will accept two values BANDS or LEVELS. If BANDS then separate calculations are to be made for each band till the base amount is reached.If LEVELS then only one is calculated and this is dependent on the level of the base Amount

relationshipProduct.description: Indicates the relationship pricing plan(if any) that has influenced the rate on this arrangement.

relationshipPercentage.description: Rate of margin(discount or uplift) due to the relationship of the customer with the bank

relationshipAmount.description: Flat amount as evaluated by the relationship of the customer with the bank. Would be evaluated based on the RELATIONSHIP arrangements held by the customer and also the definitions in PREFERENTIAL.PRICING as well as the rules in PRICING.RULES of this arrangement product.

relationshipVariation.description: It denotes the special considerations for the arrangement based on the customer relationship with the bank

penaltyDays.description: Specifies the number of days penalty will be applied for early redemption or violating the initial agreement

rentReturn.description: Indicates if unamortised rent amount has to be returned if a safe deposit box is closed before the tenure

If BANDS then separate calculations are to be made for each band till the base amount is reached.If LEVELS then only one is calculated and this is dependent on the level of the base Amount

relationshipProduct.description: Indicates the relationship pricing plan(if any) that has influenced the rate on this arrangement.

relationshipPercentage.description: Rate of margin(discount or uplift) due to the relationship of the customer with the bank

relationshipAmount.description: Flat amount as evaluated by the relationship of the customer with the bank. Would be evaluated based on the RELATIONSHIP arrangements held by the customer and also the definitions in PREFERENTIAL.PRICING as well as the rules in PRICING.RULES of this arrangement product.

relationshipVariation.description: It denotes the special considerations for the arrangement based on the customer relationship with the bank

penaltyDays.description: Specifies the number of days penalty will be applied for early redemption or violating the initial agreement

rentReturn.description: Indicates if unamortised rent amount has to be returned if a safe deposit box is closed before the tenure

tiers.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts. Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

tierType.description: Type of the tier rate. Allowed values: - BAND: rates apply within each band - LEVEL: a common rate applies, determined by the highest level

calculationType.description: Indicates calculation type for the given source balance

chgAmount.description: Based on the calculation type (flat or unit) the charge amount specified here will be set

tier.description: If the charge calculated for this tier is less than the amount defined in this field then minimum amount will be the charge amount for this tier.

tierMaxCharge.description: Indicates the maximum monetary amount that can be specified for the tier. Applies for Charge with Level/Band Types

upTo.description: The monetary amount for the tier

tierCount.description: When charges are to be calculated based on activity count, this attribute acts as threshold for the number of times an activity is performed

chargeId.description: This indicates the charge code which will be triggered for payment stop instruction. Applicable when financial institutions would like to charge for stop payment of cheque etc.

fixedAmount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

chargeRoutine.description: This field enables the user to define a routine to apply complex conditions to calculate the charge amount as required by the user

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

customerRole.description: Indicates role of a customer for an arrangement.

taxPercentage.description: Tax liability percentage for the associated Customer

limitAllocactionPercentage.description: Indicates percentage of limit allocated to the customer out of overall limit

liabilityPercentage.description: Liability percentage allocated to the associated Customer

deliveryReqd.description: Determines whether delivery messages need to be processed for the customer

otherParties.description: It specifies the other parties who are not legal owners of the arrangement

otherParty.description: It specifies the other parties who are not legal owners of the arrangement

otherPartyRole.description: It specifies the description about the other parties mentioned

otherPartyNotes.description: It specifies the description about the other parties mentioned

jointLiability.description: Identifies if there is a joint liability on the limit record Allowed values: -YES -NO

inActiveMilitaryService.description: Indicates if customer or account holder is in active military service

accountTitlingOperand.description: Account Title operand to be used while building the Title information in notices. Can be AND or OR. When AND is specified, it indicates that all beneficiaries are jointly responsible. When OR is specified, it indicates that each beneficiary can be solely responsible for the account.

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

interest.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate Allowed values: null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

fixedRate.description: Numeric value for the interest rate entered manually.

floatingRate.description: The interest rate is chosen from a selection of values which represent different interest types and rates.

linkedRateIndicator.description: The interest rate for the tier can be linked to that of another account, YES/NO indicator

minimumTierRate.description: A minimum interest rate can be applied at each tier.

maximumTierRate.description: The maximum rate that can be applied at each tier.

effectiveRate.description: Indicates the actual interest rate applied for the account after adjustment/tier calculation/based on basic or Periodic index value

tierAmount.description: The monetary amount for the tier.

tierNegativeRate.description: A negative interest rate can be applied at each tier, select Yes, No, Block margin

tierPercent.description: Applicable tier percentage (between 0 and 100) for interest calculations based on amount bands

periodicIndex.description: Denotes an index which points to the right period of the securities or holdings.

periodicRate.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriodType.description: Specify the period which will be used to fetch the interest rate

periodicPeriod.description: Define the period which has to be used to calculate the interest rate

periodicMethod.description: Indicates the method used to calculate the interest rate for period interest setup

initialResetDate.description: Specifies the initial date from which the interest rate has to be reset.  If specified along with a reset frequency, the initial reset date will be used for deriving the subsequent reset dates

periodicReset.description: Indicates the reset period of the periodic index defined

customRate.description: It denotes whether or not interest needs be calculated in a custom manner

marginType.description: Defines whether there are single or multiple margins to be considered while arriving at the applicable interest rate  Allowed values:  null (default): multiple margins may be defined SINGLE: only a single margin is allowed

marginOperation.description: This is the operand which determines if a margin is added or subtracted from the interest rate. Options are ADD or SUB

marginRate.description: This is the rate applied over the default interest rate or commission rate to achieve the actual rate.

onActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

recalculate.description: Recalculates the periodic rate when certain activities (e.g. LENDING-CHANGE-PRINCIPAL.INTEREST, LENDING-DISBURSE-COMMITMENT) is processed

references.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

customType.description: Defines the type of attribute used to calculate the custom rate. It is an identifier for the customized rate attributes. It may hold user defined values like currency

customName.description: Defines the name of the customized rate attribute to calculate the custom rate

customValue.description: Defines the value for the corresponding customized rate attribute to calculate custom rate

rateTierType.description: Different interest rates can be applied for tiers determined by monetary amounts.  Standard selection to choose from - Single, Level, Banded

linkedArrangement.description: The account which is linked for calculating interest that should be applied to this account

dayBasis.description: Contains the day basis on which the interest is calculated. Eg: 366/366, 360/365 (Interest days/days in the year)

interestCalcThreshold.description: Allows users to set a balance threshold which will need to be met to calculate interest

accrualRule.description: Determines the amounts which has to be included in each day's balance while accruing interest, the actual days to include in the period(eg: first day, last day) and how to round any calculations

compounding.description: This field defines the number of compounding periods to be applied.Compounding interest applies a factor to the compound interest calculation based upon the number of compounding periods in the year

compoundYieldMethod.description: Indicates how the effective rate is calculated, when set to YIELD the interest rate defined is taken as the annual effective rate

minIntAmount.description: Defines the minimum interest amount that will be compared to the system calculated interest amount. If the interest calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup  either the min interest amount would be applied or it would be waived

minIntWaive.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

referLimit.description: This field indicates if the calculated interest amount has to be waived or adjusted. If the field is set to YES, then the system will waive the interest amount if it is less than the minimum interest amount specified.If NULL value is set and if the calculated interest amount is less than the minimum interest amount  specified, then system will post the minimum interest amount

suppressAccrual.description: Indicates whether accruals needs to be Suppressed or Accrual should be done for the Alternate Interest Property. Allowed values are Yes, Alternate, info only, null

accountingMode.description: Identifies the modes used in accounting system i.e. 'EXTERNAL' indicates external accounting mode.

periodicResetDateConvention.description: Specifies the date convention to be followed for the reset frequency i.e. if the cycled periodic reset date falls on a non-working day, the reset date will be moved based on the option chosen.

overdue.description: Denotes the current ageing status of the arrangement

ageingType.description: It denotes whether the ageing of arrangements should be based on the no of days or the no of outstanding bills . Allowed values are Bills or Days

ageing.description: It denotes either the no of days or no of bills  after which the arrangement moves to the specified ageing status . The number is followed by a 'B' if it denotes the no of bills

notice.description: It represents the calendar days post to a aging status that a chaser advice to be sent

noticeFrequency.description: It denotes the frequency in which chasers need to be sent out, so long as the account remains in the corresponding status.

ageAll.description: Indicates whether all bills of the arrangement should age to the current status . Allowed values are yes or no

suspend.description: Indicates whether the arrangement needs to be suspended when the current aging status is reached.

balance.description: The monetary value of each balance type for an account is itemised.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

payTolerance.description: Represents the tolerance percentage that needs to be applied on the bill's original amount

tolCCY.description: If the currency mentioned here matches the bills currency then the tolerance amount is considered for comparison

actions.description: Refers to view or cancel options.

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

payment.description: Indicates the transfer of money between two or more parties or accounts

paymentType.description: Indicates if the payment is Customer (C) type or Bank (B) type

paymentMethod.description: Method chosen to make the payment

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency at which a payment is required to be generated

billType.description: The type of payment obligation generated

billLeadDays.description: If Bill is to be produced ahead of the due date, then the number of lead days is specified here. Accepted format is ND, where N is the number of days

propertyId.description: The identifier of the product condition

dueFrequency.description: Defines the frequency date when a payment  has to be made due. When not mentioned, this will be same as the paymentFrequency

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

endDate.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

numberOfPayments.description: Indicates the total number of payments for the loan or deposit. Then based on the payment frequency, the payment end date will be calculated.

adhocPaymentAmount.description: One time payment amount made as part of the repayment activity. For scheduled payments  it indicates the actual amount paid instead of the scheduledPaymentAmount.

onThisActivity.description: Indicates the activities which will necessiate a recalculation of the schedules, ex, change of term, principal increase, etc,.

amortisationTerm.description: Indicates the amortisation term. When specified, the repayment amount is calculated based on the amortisation term insteam of the account term. When the amortisation term is less than account term, there will be a residual amount to be paid at the maturity.

residualAmount.description: The amount to be paid at the maturity date

combineBills.description: Indicates if bills of same due date and same pament method(DUE or CAPITALISE) should be combined

applyPaymentActivity.description: Indicates the action that will be performed when there is unallocated amount or unidentified transaction type

includePrincipalPayment.description: Flag to indicate if the IRA account is an inherited account

allowedProducts.description: Product or products allowed to be used within the product bundle.

allowedProductId.description: The list of products belonging to the same product group that the arrangement can switch to

changeDateType.description: Determines whether the product change should happen within the given period or on reaching maturity of the arrangement

changePeriod.description: Denotes the period after which the user can change the arrangement from one product to another

changeDate.description: Denotes the date on which arrangement would change from an existing product to a new product

changeActivity.description: Denotes the activity which will be triggered at the time of loan renewal.

priorDays.description: Indicates the number of days prior to  which change product needs to be triggered from the actual change product date

changeToProductId.description: Specifies the product to which the arrangement must change to on the given period or date

initiationType.description: It indicates whether the renewal activity will be triggered automatically or manually by the user. Possible values are AUTO , MANUAL

defaultActivity.description: Determines the defalut Activity which will be triggered on the day of renewal when INITIATION.TYPE is equal to MANUAL

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

trancheStartDate.description: Start date after which the tracheAmount can be withdrawn from the loan as per the withdrawal agreement.

trancheEndDate.description: End date by when the tracheAmount can be withdrawn from the loan as per the withdrawal agreement made

trancheAmount.description: Amount agreed for withdrawal from the loan on within the trancheStateDates and trancheEndDates

commitmenttype.description: Defines the type of commitment schedule being made. Options available are COMMITMENT.SCHEDULE or UNAVAILABILITY.SCHEDULE

commitmentType.description: Defines the type of commitment schedule being made. Options available are COMMITMENT.SCHEDULE or UNAVAILABILITY.SCHEDULE

commitmentStartDate.description: Defines the start date for the commitmentAmount for the Commitment type

commitmentEndDate.description: Defines the end date for the commitmentAmount for the Commitment type

commitmentAmount.description: Indicates the total amount which will be lent or deposited for the term

changeAmount.description: Indicates the amount by which the original commitment amount increased or decreased.

term.description: Indicates the period to which the BID and OFFER rates apply

revolving.description: Indicates if commitment is revolving or non revolving in nature

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).

maturityDate.description: Indicates maturity date of the contract

matDateType.description: Maturity date can be set to a fixed date or can set to align with the last payment date. When it has to be alinged with last payment date, indicate the option as PAYMENT.END.DATE

maturityDateConvention.description: Specifies the date convention for the maturity date calculation. When DATE.CONVENTION is specified, holiday calendar will be checked against date convention specified for the account. Otherwise the business calendar will be used for checking holidays.

termToleranceDays.description: Specifies the tolerance days beyond which TERM will be recalculated on change of maturity date. Ex, if TERM was 360D and Maturity date was on 31-Mar-2020, and tolerance days is 3D, of maturity date is changed to 2-Apr-2020, the TERM will be still remain as 360D. if there was no tolerance the TERM will be changed to 362D

fullCommitmentActivity.description: When set to YES, full disbursement activity will be raised when a deposit or loan is fully funded or disbursed.

hasTranches.description: Indicates if the loan is disbursed through a withdrawal agreement where the agreed loan amount is available for withdrawal upon the agreed schedule or based on user request.

renewalCoolingPeriod.description: Number of days to be considered for closure after renewal or rollover start date

fixedamount.description: Indicates the monetary amount that is fixed during the associated account's effective period

expiryDays.description: Defines the expiry date for the payoff bill. The number of days defined would be taken as working days and expiry date for the payoff bill would be calculated as payoff date plus the number of working days defined in this field. When the expiry date is reached the payoff bill would be deleted

settleDues.description: Specifies if the amounts made due to the customer between the simulation start date and payoff effective date, should be considered settled or not. By setting this field to YES, auto settlement of future dues would be enabled and setting it to null or NO will not settle the due amounts automatically

operand.description: This field along with fieldName and value, defines the conditions for the alert to be triggered.

payin.description: Indicates the transaction reference for which the history of transactions is requested. It is steered by the attribute 'booked' given the start date and end date or the entry from which the history is requested

payinSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payin Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payinRule.description: Contains the rule on which the system should utilise the funds available in the pay in account during the settlement process. Options are Full, Partial and None

payinSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the bills due

payinRCType.description: Contains the transaction type used by the transaction recycler for retrying the debits

payinRCCondition.description: Contains the transaction recycling rules which define the set of retry conditions

payinPaymentType.description: It denotes the payment type based on which the repayment settlement instruction will be processed

ddMandateReference.description: Contains the direct debit mandate reference (dd) when the settlement method is set to direct debit. The dd reference is typically the account number followed by a suffix, for example 15245.1

payinAccount.description: Contains the account from which funds are to be debited against the payment type

payinBeneficiary.description: Contains the beneficiary Id used for settlement of the bills due

payinPOProduct.description: Contains the payment order product Id for which the payment is initiated

payinPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the bills due

payinAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the bills due

payinActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to debit the customer account for settlement of the bills due

payoutSettlement.description: Flag to indicate whether Payout Settlement instruction is required or not.Valid input is Yes or No.Default value is Yes.

payoutSettlementActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used for settlement of the payables

payoutPropertyClass.description: Contains the different payout options, for example charge, interest or principal on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutProperty.description: Contains the different payout options, for example management charge, principal interest or commitment on which the payout settlement instructions would be processed

payoutAccount.description: The account to which a settlement amount is transferred.

payoutBeneficiary.description: The beneficiary that payment should be made to .

payoutPOProduct.description: Contains the payout payment order product for which payment is initiated

payoutPercentage.description: Contains the percentage of the payment amount used for settlement of the payables

payoutAmount.description: Contains the finite amount of the payment used for settlement of the payables

payoutActivity.description: Contains the transaction type used to credit the customer account for settlement of the payables

defaultSettlementAccount.description: Default settlement account to be used for all incoming payments and outgoing settlements when a specific settlement account is not provided for each payment type.

payByCheck.description: Indicates if payment or settlement has to be done through check

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.
